item.title: UnitedHealth’s stock falls to five-year low as outlook was reinstated but missed expectations
item.description: The health insurance giant’s second-quarter profit missed expectations as it continues to face higher medical costs.

item.title: Consumer confidence rebounds slightly in July on easing inflation fears and higher stock prices
item.description: “Consumers are rattled,” one analyst noted, “and rattled consumers spend less than confident consumers.”

item.title: The stock market is on the brink of a 5%-10% loss — but don’t panic. Here’s what to do instead.
item.description: Cautious insiders, euphoric investors and seasonal weakness — what could go wrong?

item.title: Job openings decline and hiring tapers off due to trade wars. The good news? Layoffs are still low.
